intro: Aquilegia vulgaris subsp. nemoralis, commonly known as the wood anemone, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has palmate leaves and often grows in woodland habitats, preferring moist, shaded environments. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable component of temperate forest ecosystems.
